The Opportunity Mollie is looking to hire a Financial Risk Lead to improve and further expand the financial risk framework across all relevant financial risk areas. As a payment institution Mollie is exposed to various financial risks related to working with merchants, financial counterparties and group cash management processes. Mollie is now looking to grow and further expand the holistic scope of financial risk. The Financial Risk Lead is a part of the second line Risk Department, which covers a wide range of risk areas (Operational, IT, Security & Privacy). This role reports into the Group Head of Risk and is based in our head-office in Amsterdam or office in London, UK. You will take a leading role in improving and scaling second line risk responsibilities on a variety of financial risk topics. You’ll be working closely with our first line Credit Risk, Merchant Finance and Treasury teams to build out a strong financial risk framework. Financial risks in scope of this role include performing oversight of (i.a.) various types of credit risk, liquidity, FX, investment and solvency risks. What you’ll be doing Challenge and monitor adherence to Mollie’s Credit Risk Framework, while acting as an escalation point for the first line in making merchant credit risk decisions; Build a strong financial risk framework, covering all financial risks in Mollie’s Risk Taxonomy. This includes oversight of capital requirements, as well as various types of credit risk, liquidity, FX, solvency, investment risk and other financial risk exposures the Mollie Group has; Overseeing regulatory obligations and identifying gaps in financial policies and procedures; Challenge and monitor Mollie’s financial risk appetite and work with the business s to ensure risk appetite thresholds are closely monitored and actioned where necessary; Support the organisation in doing financial scenario analyses in (major) product developments, solvability assessments and recovery planning. Increase awareness on financial risks and impact across the organisation through training and awareness; Advise and challenge the finance department on regulatory reporting requirements (supervisory and statistical reports). What you’ll bring Extensive knowledge of financial risk management, including relevant regulations 7+ years of experience in financial risk management, preferably in the financial services industry (experience gained at a payment services provider or consultancy firm is a plus); Profound knowledge of credit risk-, investment risk-, or interest rate risk management, or of enterprise risk management topics such as recovery & resolution planning; Knowledge of and/or experience with financial reporting, tax or budgeting processes is a plus; Can do attitude and creative problem solver - working closely with Credit Risk and Finance teams to establish pragmatic solutions and processes; A (master’s) degree with a background in (quantitative) finance, business administration, economics, econometrics, or another relevant degree; Experience in a (highly) regulated environment, preferably the financial services industry; Excellent English oral and written communication skills. We encourage candidates to apply, even if they don't meet every requirement. We value diverse perspectives and recognise that certain skills can be developed and acquired on the job. If you are excited about the role and eager to learn, your application is more than welcome!
